sdumitriu - (15:52): Looking at XWIKI-5208  
sdumitriu - (15:52): http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-5208  
sdumitriu - (15:52): Why do you xml-escape the document language?  
sdumitriu - (15:53): In Java  
abusenius - (15:53): well, it is less work than escaping it everywhere else  
abusenius - (15:54): usually it only contains a-z  
abusenius - (15:54): so escaping it does not change anything  
abusenius - (15:54): unless you try to inject something else  
abusenius - (15:55): language codes only contain [a-zA-Z\_] AFAIK  
sdumitriu - (15:55): Yep  
sdumitriu - (15:55): I was actually thinking that we should check that the language is really valid  
sdumitriu - (15:55): Something like this:  
sdumitriu - (15:55): Locale l = new Locale("hurasa", "US");  
sdumitriu - (15:55):         System.out.println(l.getISO3Language() + ' ' + l.getLanguage());  
sdumitriu - (15:56): Throws exception  
abusenius - (15:56): yea, that would also do it I guess  
abusenius - (15:56): do we always use correct language codes?  
sdumitriu - (15:56): There's also empty string and "default"  
sdumitriu - (15:57): The others are always valid

sdumitriu - (21:08): vmassol: I hope you appreciate the class editor tests  
vmassol - (21:09): sdumitriu: I hope you have written them because you're convinced they're useful and not to please me! ;)  
sdumitriu - (21:10): Yes, sure  
sdumitriu - (21:10): I know TDD is good  
sdumitriu - (21:10): It's just that most times I find it too hard to write tests  
vmassol - (21:11): yes we need to make it as easy as possible and continuously work on that  
sdumitriu - (21:11): And sometimes I just finish fixing the code too soon, before I think about the test  
vmassol - (21:11): if you start by wrtiing tests you'll not find them much of a burden actually  
vmassol - (21:11): you'll find them as a tool to help your design and guide you along the way  
vmassol - (21:11): (for unit tests)  
vmassol - (21:11): (functional tests are a different beast)  
vmassol - (21:12): and we do need to reduce to the max our functional tests and have unit tests wherever possible instead  
vmassol - (21:12): (I was reminded of this during the conference I attended for the past 2 days)  
vmassol - (21:13): sorry, got to go watch a movie with my kid  
vmassol - (21:13): have fun  
sdumitriu - (21:13): Have fun
